document_data.name: The Five Lions
document_data.mainbody: '''The Five Lions''' was an inn in the realm of [[Turmish]] in the [[Vilhon Reach]] in the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite polyhedron/98/Elminster's Everwinking Eye: More Hidden Powers of Turmish|25}}{{Cite polyhedron/103/Elminster's Everwinking Eye: A Treasure Tour of Turmish|24}}
document_data.Location: An isolated inn, it stood on a side-trail a little way beyond the lip of the [[Allascar]] valley and on the steep slope down to the great [[the Faraway|Faraway]] forest.
document_data.Inhabitants: As well as being an inn, it was the base of operations and the namesake of an [[adventuring company]], [[The Five Lions (adventuring company)|the Five Lions]]. They provided training to young [[adventurer]]s.
document_data.History: During the [[Ten Black Days of Eleint]] in the {{yearlinkName|1347}},<ref> several members of the [[Lions' Dynasty|royal family]] escaped [[Tethyr]] and somehow made it to The Five Lions inn. However, they were followed by rebels, who killed them in the woods.''Polyhedron'' #98 only says "When strife came to Tethyr..." It's presumed this refers to the triggering event, rather than the following two strife-filled decades of the [[Tethyrian Interregnum]]. The history of the Ten Black Days implies all the royal family were killed in the castle fire, but it is known that many nobles escaped to Amn. Thus, it is likely these were royal-related nobles.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: These events gave rise to a rumor that, within the cellars of The Five Lions inn, there was a permanent ''[[gate]]'' of great age that connected to some hidden location in [[Amn]]. It was supposed both the fleeing royals and the pursuing rebels had found and gained access to this ''gate''.
